newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk planes bomb rebel Kurd camps in north Iraq.
newsitem.headline: Turk planes bomb rebel Kurd camps in north Iraq.

text.p: Turkish military aircraft bombed and destroyed five rebel Kurd camps inside northern Iraq on Wednesday, state-run Anatolian news agency said.

It said F-4 fighter planes and helicopters supported by around 10,000 pro-state Kurd militiamen mounted the operation in the early hours of Wednesday, destroying camps named as Kelmehmet, Besta, Yassikaya, Karakovan and Meydankol.
There were no details of casualties during the operation but the bodies of five people killed in earlier clashes were found. The operation was continuing, the agency said.

Thousands of Turkish troops launched a six-week-long operation into northern Iraq in May in an attempt to eliminate Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) units who use the area to mount raids into southeastern Turkey.
More than 26,000 people have died in 13 years of conflict between the Turkish armed forces and the PKK which is fighting for self-rule in the mainly Kurdish southeast of Turkey.
